Class LockableAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • LockableAccount

  • public class LockableAccount
extends java.lang.Object
    Emulates a simple account with basic information and the ability to be locked and unlocked. An unlocked account shows all information while a locked account will hide many of the details. This demonstrates how encapsulation can be used to implement information hiding; as class designers we have full control over what information can be accessed, how it is accessed, and how it is altered.
    Author:
    Patrick Cavanaugh

    • Constructor Detail

      • LockableAccount

        public LockableAccount(java.lang.String userNameIn,
                       int accountNumberIn,
                       java.lang.String emailAddressIn,
                       java.lang.String passwordIn)
        Constructor used to create a new LockableAccount. Any String is valid for userName, emailAddress, and password. The accountNumber is a controlled value and should be set using the same rules as the setAccount method. A newly created account will be locked.
        Parameters:
        userNameIn - Account user name
        accountNumberIn - Requested account number for the account
        emailAddressIn - Account email address
        passwordIn - Account password

    • Method Detail

      • setAccountNumber

        public void setAccountNumber(int accountNumberIn)
        Attempts to set the account number to the requested value. If the passed value is between the account minimum and maximum inclusive, accountNumber will be set to the passed value. If the account number is not within the valid range, accountNumber will be set to -1 to denote an invalid account number.
        Parameters:
        accountNumberIn - The account number requested.

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Locks the account.

      • unlock

        public boolean unlock(java.lang.String passwordIn)
        Attempts to unlock the account with the passed password String. Only if the passed password matches the account's password the account will be unlocked by setting locked to false. Returns true if successfully unlocked, false otherwise. If the password passed is null it is treated the same as an incorrect password.
        Parameters:
        passwordIn - Password to attempt to unlock the account
        Returns:
        Whether or not the account is unlocked

      • addNotification

        public void addNotification(java.lang.String notificationIn)
        Sets the notification of the account.
        Parameters:
        notificationIn - The notification String.

      • getEmailAddress

        public java.lang.String getEmailAddress()
        Returns the account's email address; the String returned depends on the locked state of the account. If the account is not locked it will return the emailAddress as it is stored. If the account is locked the String will be the first character of the emailAddress with the remainder of the characters in the emailAdress as asterisks *.
        Returns:
        The full or partially hidden email address of the account

      • getAccountNumberString

        public java.lang.String getAccountNumberString()
        Returns the account number; the String returned depends on the locked state of the account and if the account number is valid. If the account number is invalid returns the String "Invalid account number, please contact customer support" whether or not the account is unlocked. If the account number is valid and the account is unlocked it will return the account number as a String; if the account is locked it will return asterisks in place of the digits.
        Returns:
        The full or partially hidden account number

      • getNotification

        public java.lang.String getNotification()
        Returns the notification; the String returned depends on the locked state of the account and if there is a notification. If there is no notification returns the String "No notification". If there is a notification and the account is unlocked it will return the notification. If there is a notification and the account is locked it will return the String "You have a notification".
        Returns:
        The notification String

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the information of the account; the String returned depends on the locked state of the account. If the account is unlocked it will clear the notification by setting it to null. Uses the getter methods for account number, email address, and notification to ensure the appropriate values are displayed depending on the locked state of the account.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String representing this account
